Key Match Events: Congo DR came from a goal behind to equalize in the 27th minute and then scored again in the 65th minute with a penalty to take the lead before halftime.
Congo DR scored three goals in total, with Chancel Mbemba, Yoane Wissa, and Arthur Masuaku contributing to the victory.
Guinea scored an early goal in the 21st minute through Mohamed Bayo, who converted a penalty.
The match saw 12 shot attempts in total, with Congo DR having 3 shots on target and Guinea 3 as well.
Pre-Game Insights: The match was a quarter-final of the Africa Cup of Nations, with DR Congo and Guinea aiming to advance to the semi-finals.
Congo DR was slight favorites with a line of -0.5 against Guinea in the match odds.
Post-Match Reflections: DR Congo's head coach expressed satisfaction with the team's resilience after coming back from an early deficit.
Guinea's manager acknowledged the defensive lapses that led to their defeat.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at the Stade Olympique Alassane Ouattara in Abidjan, Ivory Coast, with an attendance of 33,278 fans.
The referee was Mustapha Ghorbal, who oversaw the game with a total of 4 yellow cards shown.
Others: The match was part of the 2024 Africa Cup of Nations, with DR Congo and Guinea aiming to reach the semi-finals.
